summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 6, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It reveals that Epstein was in custody, search warrants were being executed, and that a flight manifest listed Epstein and two pilots. The emails also discuss the timing of unsealing the indictment.

persons.name: Margolin, James
persons.role: Chief Public Information Officer, U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: He emails to ask if the indictment against Epstein will be unsealed before Monday morning.

persons.name: Berman, Geoffrey
persons.role: U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: He sends emails confirming that Epstein is in custody, search warrants are being executed, and that Epstein is confirmed on board a flight.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; confirmed to be in custody and listed on a flight manifest with two pilots.

persons.name: Moses, Judge
persons.context: Signed the search warrant related to the Epstein investigation on the morning of July 6, 2019.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the investigation and arrest of Epstein.
Both are part of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, communicating about the Epstein case.
Judge Moses signed the search warrant requested by Berman's office for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and Search Warrants Executed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is taken into custody, and search warrants related to the investigation are being executed.

events.title: Search Warrant Signed by Judge Moses
events.description: Judge Moses signs a search warrant in the morning, authorizing law enforcement actions in the Epstein case.

events.title: Flight Manifest Received
events.description: The FBI receives a flight manifest from Customs and Border Protection listing Epstein and two pilots, indicating travel plans.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was confirmed to be in custody on July 6, 2019, as part of an investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Search warrants related to the Epstein case were being executed on July 6, 2019, after being signed by Judge Moses that morning.
A flight manifest obtained by the FBI from Customs and Border Protection listed Epstein and two pilots, suggesting imminent travel.
Internal emails show coordination among SDNY officials about the timing of unsealing the indictment against Epstein.
